**Polar Vortex** is a level 9 [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") spell that creates a frenzy of raging wind up to 6 tiles around you, dealing catastrophic [cold](/Cold "Cold") damage.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Gallery](#Gallery)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Polar Vortex creates [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") of raging wind, dealing a base of `12d(pow/15)` damage per 1.0 turn.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Only 50% of damage is affected by [cold resistance](/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

The damage is then adjusted by:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- Percentage of tiles open. In tight spaces, damage is reduced. Damage is multiplied by the ratio, `(tiles with wind) / (tiles that could have wind)`.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- "Duration-radius" factor. Creatures on the outside of the vortex will receive the most damage.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

The vortex's radius is equal to `sqrt(aut_passed) * 7/5`, or roughly 1 tile per 1.0 turn, with a max. of 5 tiles. Creatures and [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud") caught inside will rotate in a counterclockwise fashion. The "rotation" is a square shape, and done at a rate of \~1 full rotation per 6 turns.

While casting the spell, the caster and anything caught inside will [fly](/Fly "Fly") for a short period of time. Once it ends, there's a grace period of 1 turn until flight ends.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Monsters won't make any effort to avoid falling into [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") or [lava](/Lava "Lava").

Polar Vortex lasts for 6 turns. The vortex immediately ends if you [blink](/Blink "Blink") or [teleport](/Teleport "Teleport") via any means, or if you enter another floor. After it ends, it has a cooldown of 3.5 - 4.5 turns.

Creatures who are currently casting Polar Vortex (including [twisters](/Twister "Twister")) are immune to other creatures' Polar Vortex. No other monster is immune.

## Strategy

While Polar Vortex has poor damage/turn compared to other level 9 spells, it has great MP efficiency. For a single, 9 MP cast, you'll get up to 6 turns of damage. Plus, you can cast other spells while the vortex is running. Great in an open area, especially against crowds. The ability to pierce cold resistance is also useful for Ice Magic specialists.

The downsides (other than damage/turn) mostly stem from the vortex mechanic: it is much weaker in a cramped area, has a short radius (for most of the duration), and a lengthy cooldown.

As a single school spell, Polar Vortex is easier to train than the likes of [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm") or [Chain Lightning](/Chain_Lightning "Chain Lightning"), but it's still a significant XP investment. In a 3 rune game, training for a level 9 spell usually means sacrificing on your defenses. Yet, as a low-range, damage over time spell that excels in open areas, you'll want good defenses, thus making this spell harder to justify. Polar Vortex can still be worth using, but don't rush for it.

### Tips & Tricks

- When the radius is 5, the amount of noise is 15. This number is multiplied by the delay of your last action (in [auts](/Aut "Aut")) and divided by 10.
- Be careful not to use [Blink](/Blink "Blink") while the spell is up, unless you specifically want to end its effects.
- Any [trees](/Tree "Tree") within Polar Vortex's range have a chance of being destroyed by the spell.

## Gallery

[![](/images/thumb/b/b6/Polar_Vortex_demo.png/350px-Polar_Vortex_demo.png)](/File:Polar_Vortex_demo.png)



Polar Vortex at max radius.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Polar Vortex was 60% irresistible.
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Polar Vortex's power was not stored on cast. Using [Sif Muna](/Sif_Muna "Sif Muna")'s Divine Exegesis would cause a 0 power vortex after the first turn. Also, switching gear would recheck the power.
- Polar Vortex was added in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), as a rethemed version of [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado"). Comparative to Tornado, Vortex deals 33% more damage, but is partially resistible. In addition, a few monsters lost rTornado.

 Polar Vortex
Level 9
School1 Ice
Source(s) Book of Ice
Casting noise 5
Spell noise 15
Power Cap 200
Range 5
Flags Area
Turns the air around the caster into a freezing vortex, doing tremendous damage to everyone caught in it that can only partially be mitigated by resistance to cold. Those affected will also be swept up into the air and tossed around. Only the eye of the storm is a safe place, and it follows the caster. The vortex is unable to follow the caster through long-distance translocations. The spell's effectiveness is greatly diminished in closed areas. After the vortex fades, it cannot be called forth again for a short time.

Polar Vortex is a level 9 Ice Magic spell that creates a frenzy of raging wind up to 6 tiles around you, dealing catastrophic cold damage.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy

  • 3 Gallery

Useful Info

Polar Vortex creates clouds of raging wind, dealing a base of 12d(pow/15) damage per 1.0 turn.[1] Only 50% of damage is affected by cold resistance.

  • "Duration-radius" factor. Creatures on the outside of the vortex will receive the most damage.[4]

The vortex's radius is equal to sqrt(aut_passed) * 7/5, or roughly 1 tile per 1.0 turn, with a max. of 5 tiles. Creatures and clouds caught inside will rotate in a counterclockwise fashion. The "rotation" is a square shape, and done at a rate of ~1 full rotation per 6 turns.

Creatures who are currently casting Polar Vortex (including twisters) are immune to other creatures' Polar Vortex. No other monster is immune.

While Polar Vortex has poor damage/turn compared to other level 9 spells, it has great MP efficiency. For a single, 9 MP cast, you'll get up to 6 turns of damage. Plus, you can cast other spells while the vortex is running. Great in an open area, especially against crowds. The ability to pierce cold resistance is also useful for Ice Magic specialists.

The downsides (other than damage/turn) mostly stem from the vortex mechanic: it is much weaker in a cramped area, has a short radius (for most of the duration), and a lengthy cooldown.

As a single school spell, Polar Vortex is easier to train than the likes of Fire Storm or Chain Lightning, but it's still a significant XP investment. In a 3 rune game, training for a level 9 spell usually means sacrificing on your defenses. Yet, as a low-range, damage over time spell that excels in open areas, you'll want good defenses, thus making this spell harder to justify. Polar Vortex can still be worth using, but don't rush for it.

  • Any trees within Polar Vortex's range have a chance of being destroyed by the spell.

Gallery

Polar Vortex at max radius.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, Polar Vortex was 60% irresistible.
  • Prior to 0.28, Polar Vortex's power was not stored on cast. Using Sif Muna's Divine Exegesis would cause a 0 power vortex after the first turn. Also, switching gear would recheck the power.
  • Polar Vortex was added in 0.27, as a rethemed version of Tornado. Comparative to Tornado, Vortex deals 33% more damage, but is partially resistible. In addition, a few monsters lost rTornado.
